en.value:
There are different types of guidelines, such as practical guidelines from the European Commission setting out best practice for the prevention of risks, Council Recommendations EU Social Partners agreements and others..

The guidelines in this section are sorted by topic. For further information, click on one of the categories listed below.

The OSH Framework Directive

Workplaces, equipment, signs, personal protective equipment

Exposure to chemical agents and chemical safety

Exposure to physical hazards

Exposure to biological agents

Provisions on workload, ergonomical and psychosocial risks

Sector specific and worker related provisions

 

The summaries are available only in English, but the contained links lead to additional language versions where available.

en.value: Guidelines are non-binding documents which aim to facilitate the implementation of European directives.
